name: interelectrode
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
between electrodes (= points at which an electric current enters or leaves): Two electrodes were placed with an interelectrode distance of 6 cm. The current decreases when the interelectrode gap increases.
More examplesFewer examplesAll patients were given leads with the same interelectrode distance.A bipolar electrode with 29 mm interelectrode distance was positioned in the oesophagus.The light is focused at a point in the inter-electrode space between a gap or on one of two electrodes or a solid material.
